sentences.en: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
sentences.cn: 刚用皮条捆上，保罗对旁边站着的百夫长说，人是罗马人，又没有定罪，你们就鞭打他，有这个例吗。

sentences.en: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him.
sentences.cn: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

sentences.en: Disciples and centurion recognized Jesus is the Son of God.
sentences.cn: 当时代的人(门徒和百夫长)认耶稣是神子、是神.

sentences.en: The centurion and servant did not see Jesus this day.
sentences.cn: 百夫长和仆人当天?看过耶稣.

sentences.en: There the centurion found Alexandrian ship that was sailing to Italy and put us on board.
sentences.cn: 百夫长在那里找到一只由亚历山大里亚来,要开往意大利的船,便叫我们上了那船.

sentences.en: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy and put us on board.
sentences.cn: 在那里百夫长遇见一只亚力山太的船,要往义大利去,便叫我们上了那船.

sentences.en: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy, and he put us aboard it.
sentences.cn: 徒27:6在那里百夫长遇见一只亚力山太的船、要往义大利去 、 便叫我们上了那船.

sentences.en: This Roman Centurion was at Capernaum a town on the edge of the Sea of Galilee.
sentences.cn: 这个罗马的百夫长是驻在加利利海边的迦百农城.

sentences.en: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
sentences.cn: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长前来求助。

sentences.en: When Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
sentences.cn: 耶稣进了迦百农，有一个百夫长进前来，求他说。

trans.tran_cn: 百人队长，百夫长（古罗马的军官，指挥百人）
trans.tran_en: an army officer of ancient Rome, who was in charge of about 100 soldiers
